name: Tribal Bone Carving from New Zealand Hei-Matau
description:
HANDCARVED PENDANT

HEI- MATAU

FISH HOOK

 

THIS BEAUTIFUL HAND-CARVED PENDANT CARRIES THE SYMBOLISM OF THE MAORI, NATIVE ZEALANDERS. THIS DESIGN REPRESENTS "HEI -MATAU", WHICH IS SAID TO BESTOW THE WEARER A LIFE OF GOOD LUCK AND FORTUNE AND IS ALSO WORN AS AN AMULET TO PROTECT - ESPECIALLY OVER WATER

  THE WEARER OF A HEI-MATUA IS SEEN AS A PROVIDER AND PROTECTOR WHO IS STRONG WILLED AND DETERMINED TO SUCCEED IN LIFE. THEY ARE ALSO SYMBOLS OF POWER AND AUTHORITY WHICH ARE HELD IN GREAT REVERENCE BY THE MAORI PEOPLE

 MEASURING 1 3/4 INCHES IN LENGTH AND HUNG ON A BLACK CORD
